meanings.definition: Make a cut or gash in (something) with a sharp tool or object.
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to incise the cake for the party.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon needed to incise the patient's skin to perform the operation.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to incise a smiley face into the pumpkin for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to incise her heart like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's chisel incised intricate details into the marble sculpture.

meanings.definition: Cut into (something) with a sharp tool.
meanings.sent1: Please incise the cardboard carefully to avoid tearing it.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter had to incise the wood to create precise joints.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to incise a perfect circle out of the dough.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to incise through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler's tools allowed him to incise delicate designs on the metal.

meanings.definition: Engrave or carve (text or patterns) into a surface.
meanings.sent1: The artist will incise his signature at the bottom of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization used to incise symbols onto stone tablets.
meanings.sent3: She decided to incise a secret message on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: His memory was incised in her mind like a permanent mark.
meanings.sent5: The calligrapher's skill allowed him to incise beautiful letters on the parchment.
